issue.title: [Gandiva] Support building with Xcode 6.4
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-4068](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4068). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
In order to package Gandiva with Python wheels and conda packages on macOS, it would be useful to build and run on Xcode 6.4 if it is not too difficult. I am not sure what are the plans for upgrading past Xcode 6.4 in conda-forge

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4068?focusedCommentId=16724960) by Uwe Korn (uwe):*
Do we want to have Gandiva working with this Xcode or simply with conda-forge on OSX?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4068?focusedCommentId=16726197) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Simply with conda-forge I guess. This is the version they use to build there

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4068?focusedCommentId=16734578) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Since the Python ecosystem has moved on to LLVM 7 I doubt we are going to be able to package Gandiva for 0.12. So I'm moving this off to 0.13

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4068?focusedCommentId=16763301) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
We've moved past Xcode 6.4
